commentBody:
Funny how the same crowd who ties it self up in knots about the very notion of corporate personhood (even though usually wrong in their understanding of it) seem to have no problem with seeing that same corporation in a personal sense needing to stand up on divisive political issue and take a stand. "History gives credit to PEOPLE [emphasis added] who stand up and make decisions that are sometimes tough" according to Mr. Robinson - wait...AT&T is a person now?

If we want corporations to take stands and not support those politicians who say or do bad things, then NEITHER party should get one cent, from the bloviating and divisive Trump to the lying and divisive Clinton. But, of course, as always in these issues, one side is evil incarnate and the other cloaked in sanctity and good, right? Uh huh.
